channel.title: Help with this error?
channel.description: [code]client.java:7256: operator && cannot be applied to boolean,int if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights && playerRights == 1 || playerRights == 2 || playerRights == 3) { ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 18, 2009, 10:36:00 pm[/size][hr]Found out nevermind!

item.title: Help with this error?
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Making the player rights 1 makes every righ above it do it. Say you do player rights 2, anything under it won’t be able too, but anything higher will be able too.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this error?
item.dc:creator: @Rova Rova
item.description:
@Rova wrote:

No look I want it for only ranks 1 - 3 not 4…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this error?
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Hold ctrl + g, and search the line 7256, thats where your error is, depending on the source your using i’ll post both mute commands.

Normal 317 server:

} if (command.startsWith("mute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(5); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 1; p.sendMessage("You were just muted by: "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("You just muted: "+command.substring(5)+"!"); } else { sendMessage(""+command.substring(5)+" is either offline or name does not exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to mute");

Delta based mute:

[code] }
if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                    p.muted = true;
		writeLog(p.playerName, "mutes");
		sM("You have muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to mute..");[/code]

So replace on of yoru existing mute commands with one of these to fix it.

Read full topic
